reasoning: To effectively differentiate between candidates, categories were selected based on recurring themes and distinctive stances in the candidates' responses. The categories focus on specific, actionable policy areas where clear distinctions can be seen in the candidates' positions. These include voting rights for youth, strategies for balancing municipal finances, forest conservation priorities, approaches to school violence, and attitudes towards public transport and car use. Each category represents a key policy area with potential impact on local governance.

categories.label: Youth Voting Rights
categories.description: Candidates' positions on whether the voting age should be lowered to 16 in municipal and county elections.

categories.label: Municipal Finance Balancing Strategy
categories.description: Preferred approach for balancing municipal finances, focusing on tax rate adjustments versus budget cuts.

categories.label: Forest Conservation Priority
categories.description: Degree of support for increased municipal investment in forest conservation.

categories.label: Approach to School Violence
categories.description: Whether candidates prefer addressing school violence primarily through police involvement or social services.

categories.label: Public Transport vs Car Use
categories.description: Candidates' prioritization of public transport, cycling, and walking over car use in municipal planning.
